VEC.Q: How many ridgelines are in this ridgeline chart?
VEC.A: There are {3} slices in this chart.

SRP.Q: What is the spatial relationship of the peak of Biomass relative to the peak of Hydroelectric in terms of vertical (above/below) and horizontal (left/right) directions?
SRP.A: The peak of  Biomass is to the {right} of the peak of Hydroelectric.

VPR.Q: What distribution pattern does the ridgeline representing Hybrid Systems show?
VPR.A: The ridgeline representing Hybrid Systems shows a {Single Peak Distribution}.

VPR.Q: At what value do  Hydroelectric reach its peaks?

EVJ.Q: Which ridgeline has the highest peak
EVJ.A: The ridgeline representing {Hybrid Systems} has the highest peak.

EVJ.Q: Which label has the highest density at X =15.2?
EVJ.A: At X =15.2,the label with the highest density is {Hybrid Systems}

NF.Q: Which countries in the ridgeline chart have ridgeline peaks exceed 73? Please list the countries and corresponding peak values.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hybrid Systems or Biomass?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Biomass or Hydroelectric?
NC.A: {Biomass} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

NC.Q: Which one has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline: Hybrid Systems or Hydroelectric?
NC.A: {Hydroelectric} has a larger X value at the peak of its ridgeline.

MSR.Q: How many ridges have their peak located to the right of the average X value across all ridges?
MSR.A: There are {2} ridges whose peaks are located to the right of the average X value.

MSR.Q: What is the label of the ridge with the largest span along the mountain height?
MSR.A: The ridge with the largest span in the mountain height is {Hybrid Systems}
